reviews.text: Large art piece by Joan Miro that most folk dont even know they have walked over, needs to be seen from above to appreciate it

The Mosaic of the Pla de l'Os is a piece of public art by Joan Miró. It’s basically a mosaic integrated into the pavement on La Rambla. I’m not a fan of abstract art like this and all I can say it that it looks like a circle containing some random stuff inside.

Don’t bother unless you’re a fan Joan Miró and this kind of stuff.
Nothing bad, nothing great, just some random mosaic painted on the ground. Not much else to say about it.
Beautifal mosiac in the middle of Las Ramblas. Could do with a scrub. Very hard to write one hundred words about a mosiac to get published
Thousands of people walk over Joan Miro's pavement mosaic in the centre of Barcelona's Rambla. The mosaic is circular like the cosmos and its basic colours – yellow, blue and red – and simple forms.
This is a part of La RAmbla. There are so many people there all the time, there is no way you could take a clean photo of it, without people's feet

Never noticed this before and walked over and past it lots of times! Only noticed it as airport transfer was picking us up from there early in the morning. It's under appreciated and just shows how much we've still got to see of Barcelona :)
We stayed at the fourth floor of the hotel right in front of this beautiful mosaic. It is best seen from above!

Everyone just walks right over this. Haha
Actually it's amazing how many people don't stop and walk right past this.
Look for it La Rambla towards the water

We have strolled along La Rambla on a number of occasions and it is almost always crowded with people. It was only during our most recent visit that we noticed this large and amazing mosaic, for the first time. It was early in the morning and for once, there were not many people about.
We were amazed that we had not noticed these large brightly coloured, circular tiled patterns on the pavement previously. 
This mosaic pattern certainly brightens up an otherwise fairly dull long stretch of paving.
If you want to see it, it is located adjacent to the underground station entrance roughly half-way along La Rambla, walking between Plaza de Catalunya  and Columbus' Monument at the sea end.
So this is the center of Las Ramblas, if you there's a lot of people in Las Ramblas probably you will not notice this. So take the subway Liceu as reference.
Stumbled on this mosaic walking from our Hotel to Mercat de la Boqueria on La Rambla.  Tried to find Miro's signature but could not find it.

Joan Miro chose this spot, near his birth house in Barri Gothic, in 1976 and designed this wonderful, colorful mosaic in the pavement. Its simple forms and basic colors are so typical for the artist's expression of his childhood memories.
